comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think this is Mrs Harry Bramhall Gilbert and her daughter, Florence. Her first husband, Harry Bramhall Gilbert, died in 1911 and she remarried in January 1914. See NYT from October 7, 1913. MRS. GILBERT WILL WED CAPT. DUGMORE; Widow of H. Bramhall Gilbert Engaged to Son of Hon. Evelyn Dugmore of Guernsey. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B03E5DE133FE633A... The article mentions that her daughter Florence had "not as yet been introduced into society." The wedding was reported in the NYT on January 20, 1914 MRS. GILBERT, BRIDE OF CAPT. DUGMORE; Widow of H. Bramhall Gilbert Married to British Army Officer at Her Home. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9500E0DC1730E733A... I found myself wondering if this might be Capt. Dugmore, who represented Britain at the 1908 Olympics in the triple jump. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyril_Dugmore. The string of names "Cyril Patrick William Francis Radclyffe" matches, but the birth dates don't. The groom was described as born in 1868, while the athlete was born in 1882.

comment.author: 75421381@N00
comment._content: A careful look at the stamp in the top left corner looks like it has the date 10/21/12.
